src package¶

Source package that powers the interative web application

Submodules¶

src.utils module¶

src.utils.PosEncoder(cluster_centers, lat1, lon1, lat2, lon2)¶

Returns feature vector based on latitude & longitude By calculating distance btw the location and hotspots predicated from the original dataset.

Parameters

  • cluster_centers (list of floats) – the hotspots predicated from the original dataset.

  • lon (float/int) – the longitude of the location of interest within California

  • lat (float/int) – the latitude of the location of interest within California

src.utils.dateEncoder(month_enc, month)¶

Returns encoded features based on month

Parameters

  • month_enc (sklearn encoder) – the encodings for month

  • month (float/int) – the month of the year

src.utils.geo_model(model, model_features)¶

Returns probability of wildfire, given a model and its features

Parameters

  • model (sklearn model) – the model used for the prediction

  • model_features (float (ranging from 0 to 1)) – the contex rich features generated for predication

src.utils.getCountyNumbersDF(data, start_date, end_date)¶

Returns a new pandas dataframe with county incident numbers from a specific date range

Parameters

  • data (pandas DF) – the original dataframe from the Calfire csv

  • start_date (datetime object) – the start date which we are filtering by

  • end_date (datetime object) – the end date which we are filtering by

src.utils.getCountyPredictions(queried_counties, month)¶

Returns a new pandas dataframe with predicted county incident numbers for a specific month :param queried_counties: the counties that are being queried :type queried_counties: str :param month: the month that is being queried :type month: int

src.utils.getTrend(county, month=6, start_year=1969, end_year=2021)¶

Returns a DataFrame fo number of incidents in ‘month’ for different years between start and end data – DataFrame month – intended month start_year – the start year of inspection end_year – the end year of inspection

src.utils.get_countyInfo(county_coordinates, lat, lon)¶

Returns best match county name for given latitude & longitude

Parameters

  • county_coordinates (dictionary of county as keys and co-ordinates as values) – the county wise co-ordinates

  • lon (float/int) – the longitude of the location of interest within California

  • lat (float/int) – the latitude of the location of interest within California

  • month (int) – the month of the year for which use want to check the danger of fire incident within California

src.utils.get_hotspots(all_data)¶

Returns hotspots centers which have high probability of wildfire occurunce

Parameters

all_data (pandas DF) – cleaned and processed data set used for the whole application

src.utils.get_single_CountyPrediction(queried_county, mode='running')¶

Returns a new pandas dataframe with predicted county incident numbers for a specific month :param queried_counties: the counties that are being queried :type queried_counties: str :type month: str

src.utils.get_weatherInfo(all_data, county_coordinates, lat, lon, month)¶

Returns weather information for the sample

Parameters

  • all_data (pandas DF) – cleaned and processed data set used for the whole application

  • county_coordinates (dictionary of county as keys and co-ordinates as values) – the county wise co-ordinates

  • lon (float/int) – the longitude of the location of interest within California

  • lat (float/int) – the latitude of the location of interest within California

  • month (int) – the month of the year for which use want to check the danger of fire incident within California

src.utils.make_sample_features(all_data, encodings, extreames, weather_data, lat, lon, month)¶

Returns feature required for wildfire predication

Parameters

  • all_data (pandas DF) – cleaned and processed data set used for the whole application

  • encodings (sklearn encodigs) – the month encodings

  • extreames (list of float) – the minimum and maximum values needed for data normalization

  • weather_data (list of floats) – the weather data like temp, humidity, wind speed needed for predication

  • lon (float/int) – the longitude of the location of interest within California

  • lat (float/int) – the latitude of the location of interest within California

  • month (string) – the month of the year for which use want to check the danger of fire incident within California

src.utils.pred_func_geo(all_data, county_coordinates, model, encodings, extreames, lat, lon, month)¶

Wrapper function that, Returns probability of safety from wildfire incidents given latitude, longitude and month of the year

Parameters

  • lon (float/int) – the longitude of the location of interest within California

  • lat (float/int) – the latitude of the location of interest within California

  • month (int) – the month of the year for which use want to check the danger of fire incident within California
